New Records: Cape Verde became the first team to qualify for the knockout stages of the Africa Cup of Nations with a 3-0 victory over Mozambique.
Bebe’s extraordinary free-kick from 40 yards ensured Cape Verde’s victory.
Key Match Events: Bebe scored a brace, with his second goal coming from a dipping 30-yard free-kick.
Ryan Mendes doubled Cape Verde’s advantage with a goal after dispossessing Edmilson Dove.
Mozambique’s best effort was a tame shot straight at Vozinha, but a penalty decision was reversed by VAR after Geny Catamo went down under a challenge.
Pre-Game Insights: Cape Verde, fresh from their shock opening victory over Ghana, impressed from the early exchanges.
Post-Match Reflections: Cape Verde’s victory was seen as a crucial step toward securing a place in the knockout stages of the Africa Cup of Nations.
Mozambique were eliminated and lie bottom of Group B with one point ahead of their final group game against Ghana.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cape Verde’s lineups and key performances were detailed, including the contributions of players like Kevin Pina and Ryan Mendes.
Others: The match facts, including the full-time score, scorers, and yellow cards, were provided.The lineups for both teams were listed in detail.
